system.description:
The followers of Moses and the Old Testament are not numerous, but they are easily known for their black garb, which they wear in their travels. They live according to their own time-tested laws, which are derived from the Ten Commandments and various interpretations of the Talmud. As G-d’s chosen people, they are always before the eye of the Almighty, with all its benefits and drawbacks.

  • David’s luck: in a state of high Virtue, and when it comes to matters of life and death, they can make up to two checks per adventure with two rolls, picking the better result.
  • Lot’s misfortune: in a state of low Virtue, the gamemaster may select one occasion where they must roll a check two times, and pick the worse result.
